Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand or Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; cream slip; interior: glazed black; part of lotus flower in added red and added white; below, two bands in white; exterior: painted decoration consisting possibly of female figure to left (garment with broken maeander pattern, red blobs and sleeve with arm in outline remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Lemos suggests this sherd does not belong to a chalice but she provides no alternatives.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 2, pl. 3, no. 6)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 307, no. 1253)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0867) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Donated to the museum by the Egypt Exploration Fund
